Go Doc:

Autobinding
When creating callbacks in JavaScript, you usually need to explicitly bind a method to its instance such that the value of this is correct. With React, every method is automatically bound to its component instance (except when using ES6 class syntax). React caches the bound method such that itâ€™s extremely CPU and memory efficient. Itâ€™s also less typing!

No Autobinding
Methods follow the same semantics as regular ES6 classes, meaning that they donâ€™t automatically bind this to the instance. Youâ€™ll have to explicitly use .bind(this) or arrow functions =>:
